page.title: 08TUNNEL CEMENT W.THURROCK.
page.content: To develop the Lakeside area it has been necessary to demolish the old cement factories that were already there as part of the site. My uncle worked in the Tunnel Estate, but in 1935 when he first worked there it was called the Tunnel Cement.He helped to build the tall chimneys up to 550ft tall, also the kiln foundations and slurry basins used in the making of cement. He also worked in other factories so he was not at the Tunnel all the time.He worked there on and off until he retired.He is now 76.He usually worked in a gang of about 12 men,working only the dayshift. He wore overalls and boots for work and went to work on his bicycle. He enjoyed his work.
